VoidInvoiceProcessedEvent.name: VoidInvoiceProcessedEvent
VoidInvoiceProcessedEvent.description: Represents the notification to the customers after the process started by the /commerce/invoicing/invoices/{invoiceId}/actions/void request is complete. The request attempts to void an invoice by crediting an invoice and changing its status to Voided, which prevents further changes.

CrMemoProcessErrDtlEvents.description: A compilation of error messages and error codes for a failed request. See the ErrorDetails field for error messages and error codes.

CreditMemoId.description: The ID of the credit memo created to void the invoice as the result of a successful request.

ErrorDetails.description: If the request fails, this field shows error messages, error codes, and the ID of the record on which the errors occurred.

EventUuid.description: A universally unique identifier (UUID) that identifies a platform event message.

InvoiceId.description: The invoice that was voided as the result of a successful request.

IsSuccess.description: Required. Indicates whether the request was successful (true) or not (false).

ReplayId.description: Represents an ID value that’s populated by the system and refers to the position of the event in the event stream. Replay ID values aren’t guaranteed to be contiguous for consecutive events. A subscriber can store a replay ID value and use it on resubscription to retrieve missed events that are within the retention window.

RequestIdentifier.description: The unique ID returned in the /commerce/billing/invoices/{invoiceId}/actions/void response. Use this ID to identify the event for a specific request.

VoidInvoiceProcessedEvent.accessRules: This object is available when Billing is enabled.
